body_html:
The following error

ERROR: /srv/local/1/tmp/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/BUILD:1478:1: undeclared inclusion(s) in rule '//tensorflow/core/kernels:depth_space_ops_gpu':
this rule is missing dependency declarations for the following files included by 'tensorflow/core/kernels/spacetodepth_op_gpu.cu.cc':
  '/srv/home/tsdist/vats_deployments/hzhang-tensorflow-cd5c92d2012f19ea907a9f13a0d99ead1901e82a/ext/public/gnu/gcc/4/9/1/dist/lib/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.1/include-fixed/limits.h'

can be solved by adding the line

cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/srv/home/tsdist/vats_deployments/hzhang-tensorflow-cd5c92d2012f19ea907a9f13a0d99ead1901e82a/ext/public/gnu/gcc/4/9/1/dist/lib/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.1"

in tensorflow/third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL at around line 64.

Basically, you need to tell bazel the location of the GCC include path.

Good luck, but since you've got gcc 4.9.1 installed, it should be possible.

I've done this successfully with gcc4.8.5, also on an old system.

I've done this successfully with gcc4.8.5, also on an old system.
body:
The following error 

```
ERROR: /srv/local/1/tmp/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/BUILD:1478:1: undeclared inclusion(s) in rule '//tensorflow/core/kernels:depth_space_ops_gpu':
this rule is missing dependency declarations for the following files included by 'tensorflow/core/kernels/spacetodepth_op_gpu.cu.cc':
  '/srv/home/tsdist/vats_deployments/hzhang-tensorflow-cd5c92d2012f19ea907a9f13a0d99ead1901e82a/ext/public/gnu/gcc/4/9/1/dist/lib/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.1/include-fixed/limits.h'
```

can be solved by adding the line 

```
cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/srv/home/tsdist/vats_deployments/hzhang-tensorflow-cd5c92d2012f19ea907a9f13a0d99ead1901e82a/ext/public/gnu/gcc/4/9/1/dist/lib/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.1"
```

in `tensorflow/third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL` at around line 64.

Basically, you need to tell bazel the location of the GCC include path.

Good luck, but since you've got gcc 4.9.1 installed, it should be possible.

I've done this successfully with gcc4.8.5, also on an old system.
